review_full: We really enjoyed the food and service.  We requested red wine by the glass and were poured a very nice Malbec.  Dinner continued with bread and salad. The bread rolls and the salad were very fresh. (Salad consisted of greens, apple , celery, nuts and Roquefort...there was plenty for the two of us to share.) We ordered solomillo steaks cooked medium. Our waiter let us know that would mean still red in the center so we requested medium well. They were cooked perfectly for us and tasted great. (Grilled over charcoal added nice flavor.) For dessert we split a crepe filled with caramel sauce. It was just right to have something slightly sweet to finish our meal.

Make reservations, even for lunch. We arrived as they were opening for lunch and all tables were full shortly thereafter.

The prices are quite reasonable and this place without any prétentions will surprise you and you will leave satisfied, happy, and impressed. I can not wait to go back!

review_preview: If you love good vintage wines, this is the place to go to in Madrid. The food is fabulous also. The Jamon one of the best I tested on this trip and cut perfectly. We had salads made with their own tomatoes and peppers. A...
review_full: If you love good vintage wines, this is the place to go to in Madrid. The food is fabulous also. The Jamon one of the best I tested on this trip and cut perfectly. We had salads made with their own tomatoes and peppers. A plate of wild musrooms sauted in olive oil that was incredible. My wife had a wonderful sucking lig and I an incredibly good Steak Tartar. The WInes , the Wines the Wines. On our first day we drank a 1985 Muga Reserva that at 45 Euros was a great deal. Two days later we stopped for a quick snack had a plate of Jamon Iberico again and a plate of Mushrooms washed down with a 1981 Berberana Reserva 50 Euros that was even better than the Muga. The service was excellent and the owner David Villalon was an expert on Spanish wine. His description of the wines and the enthusiasm he displayed about the wines he sold was exceptional. He has a list of Spanish and French wines to die for. Downstairs they have a great cocktail lounge which is all the rage in Madrid. All in all this Gastro Pub is without a doubt the best I have ever been too.

title_review: Innovative bistro with wine in focus and plates to share
review_preview: We booked last minute and managed to get a slot in the very booked restaurant / wine bar. It's modern and with enthusiastic and knowledgeable staff in a small street just off Gran Vía avenue. Food was plates to share but if you prefer you...
review_full: We booked last minute and managed to get a slot in the very booked restaurant / wine bar. It's modern and with enthusiastic and knowledgeable staff in a small street just off Gran Vía avenue. Food was plates to share but if you prefer you can have your own. Innovative and pretty dishes with local produce. No set menus, you order as many plates as you feel like. Prices were very fair for the quality offered. 50-60 wines were available in glass, even half-glass in order that you can try as many as you like. The staff were very enthusiastic about the wines and happy to recommend their favourites and what suited our preferences.We went with our older "kids", 16 and 21 and they really liked it (no wine for 16-year old).  When back in Madrid we're coming back for sure.

review_preview: During my business trip, I had a chance to try out this lovely Argentinian restaurant and I'm pleased I did that.The place was full and without reserbation I had to wait a while by having their best Malbec ( which it wasn't the top...
review_full: During my business trip, I had a chance to try out this lovely Argentinian restaurant and I'm pleased I did that. The place was full and without reserbation I had to wait a while by having their best Malbec ( which it wasn't the top considering the quality of everything else ) at the bar counter having appetisers in the meanwhile watching the cook flipping lovely meat on the grill at the bbq station. Very competent and fast.  The venue was simply great. Classy and well balanced between modern furniture and taste of those Argentinian Locanda that you can find over there in buenos aires . The soft lights completed the atmosphere making the entire environment very relaxing. Tables in the main lounge were very well distributed and you could still have your own time and privacy even though all tables were taken and the restaurant was full. That meat ( filet cut) cooked medium rare was sugar in my mouth and I've enjoyed each single bite of it. Lovely . Last but not least. the personnel was great from welcoming me to greeting me good bye and I was so happy and delighted for being assisted by Jennifer who made that dinner almost perfect. Well done, she was as professional and competent as so pleasant and good looking. with compliments! Ciao EPI

title_review: Hard to see how it could be better!
review_preview: We’d read the reviews before coming but we were immediately impressed by the high level of professionalism and great customer service that the staff gave right from the start and all the way through our meal. We were celebrating a friends 50th and honestly nothing...
review_full: We’d read the reviews before coming but we were immediately impressed by the high level of professionalism and great customer service that the staff gave right from the start and all the way through our meal. We were celebrating a friends 50th and honestly nothing was too much trouble!  And the food was simply outstanding. I don’t think it’s an exaggeration to say this is probably the best steak I’ve ever eaten! We were all blown away by the quality.  The wine list was also very impressive - we selected a Don David 1700m Malbec which matched the beautiful steaks perfectly.  If you like steak this has to be on your “must do” list whilst visiting Madrid. If I’m ever back there I’ll certainly be going again.  I’d rate this five star *****

review_preview: This is a place that cares about wine and can give you an excellent introduction to the many terrific wines of Spain that take you deeper into both terroir and grape variety. And they also have a very interesting and impressive set of natural wines...
review_full: This is a place that cares about wine and can give you an excellent introduction to the many terrific wines of Spain that take you deeper into both terroir and grape variety. And they also have a very interesting and impressive set of natural wines too - wines made with natural yeast and fermentation and the minimum of sulphites.  If you have never tried them this is a good place to begin. Davide and his team know their stuff and are happy to share their knowledge and enthusiasm. Accompanying the wine are small plates to share. Every one we had from pepper salad with smoked sardine, via mushrooms to a tartare and sashimi was perfectly judged and presented. Don't go here if you are looking for huge heavy dishes. But if you enjoy good, fresh, light food, this is the place to taste the new Spain

title_review: Unassuming Bar and Restaurant in Madrid
review_preview: Tucked away on Calle de Santiago in Madrid just a few minutes from the Palace is Bar Arbonaida. We stumbled across it by chance but the food, service and staff were so good we went back two more times. The place is unassuming but very...
review_full: Tucked away on Calle de Santiago in Madrid just a few minutes from the Palace is Bar Arbonaida. We stumbled across it by chance but the food, service and staff were so good we went back two more times. The place is unassuming but very lively and frequented by local people; I think we were the only non Spanish guests each time we visited. The food was delicious, well presented and excellent value and Amanda was very helpful in recommending various dishes whilst ensuring we didn’t order too much! We were made very welcome and would recommend Arbonaida to anyone wanting an authentic taste of Madrid.

title_review: A Hidden Gem at Plaza Mayor!
review_preview: The food at this restaurant is out of this world. Presentation, flavor, and service deserve a Michelin star. We were early, just when they opened (7pm) looking for the Steak Tartare. We were greeted by Florin with wonderful celery mojitos that of course we repeately...
review_full: The food at this restaurant is out of this world. Presentation, flavor, and service deserve a Michelin star. We were early, just when they opened (7pm) looking for the Steak Tartare. We were greeted by Florin with wonderful celery mojitos that of course we repeately through the dinner. Florin explained with details but not boring the restaurant concept and the appetizers and we were really glad with his suggestions: cecina, croquetas and the butters that came with the artesenal breads were delicious. For entrees, we had the Steak Tartare (one of the best that I tried), Sirloin Steak and our daughter asked for the Beaf-Bacon Burger. Before they brough the main dishes, Chef Matias came to the table and explained the cooking process of each plate. I thought that it was because the restaurant was still almost empty, but as it was filling up quickly, I saw him going table by table doing the same thing which is really appreciated. For desserts we had Tat-crumble and the Pineapple Cannelloni with more Mojito, a Chupito and beautiful and tasty Cappuccino for the teenager. A wonderful experience and a must in Madrid and mandatory visit for all our future stops in Madrid. Thank you Chef Matias and staff.

review_preview: During our vacation in Madrid, we, two persons, stopped by Metro Bistro without an reservation at a later hour. This was no problem as there was more than enough space and we were shown to a table. The setting was modern and in a clean...
review_full: During our vacation in Madrid, we, two persons, stopped by Metro Bistro without an reservation at a later hour. This was no problem as there was more than enough space and we were shown to a table. The setting was modern and in a clean style, we liked it and thought of it as very fitting. Service was very friendly, attentive and discreet. The food was brought by one of the chefs, who impressed with great presenting skills and profound knowledge. For food, we chose various starters to share, all fantastic and in generous portions. The foie-gras stood out for us. As mains, we had the black risotto with scallop and the Segovian piglet. Both dishes were brilliant, the Segovian piglet however was a highlight of the entire trip. For desert we shared a desert and went for the tribute to chocolate which was implemented perfectly. For the wine, we went with recommendations of the service, it did not disappoint and accompanied the great food perfectly. All in all, this dining experience was perfect. We wholeheartedly recommend Metro Bistro and will definitely visit again!

review_preview: Thanks to TripAdvisor I went to this wine bar that was in the street in the back of my hotel. And what a find it was!I came in early for local times - 8:15 pm - and so was able to secure a table...
review_full: Thanks to TripAdvisor I went to this wine bar that was in the street in the back of my hotel. And what a find it was! I came in early for local times - 8:15 pm - and so was able to secure a table without a reservation. If you’re coming in at local times, say 10 pm, you’d better reserve. They kindly advised me that the kitchen didn’t open before 8:30 pm which was fine since I could enjoy one of the many wines they have by the glass. And this is the only reason why you would call this place a wine bar, the wine selection, because the food is top quality restaurant food but with the possibility to serve either full size or half portions. And they even tell you if it’s better to go for a half as a starter (which was my case). I was well taken care off by David whom I believe is the sommelier, but without pretention. He advised me throughout on wines to match with the food I ordered and I discovered some wines I otherwise would have never tasted, the first one being à German Riesling! The artichoke, shiitake, beef sauce and gambas starter was superb and the 2 month dry aged entrecôte was to die for. Excellent service, food and wine, what more could one ask for? I’ll be back!

title_review: Came here for late night dinner
review_preview: My husband and I came for a late night dinner. We were very excited to visit after hearing that it was one of the top rated restaurants in Madrid. We also liked the cool minimalist decor and overall ambience. The dinner started off great. Nice...
review_full: My husband and I came for a late night dinner. We were very excited to visit after hearing that it was one of the top rated restaurants in Madrid. We also liked the cool minimalist decor and overall ambience.  The dinner started off great. Nice olives, lovely wine, smooth vermouth on ice, and affable waiter. But then it went downhill.  We ordered the special "tacos" and hake. There was some miscommunication over what was in the tacos. The waiter described it as salmon but it turned out to be pigs ears. This is a significant difference. Had we been into pig's ears (chewy and fatty) I'm sure we would have appreciated them but that is not what we thought we were getting into. Out for a fun time, we were in great spirits and found the situation funny! A surly waiter who we explained everything to had zero sense of humor or empathy and simply removed them from our table.  Next came the hake, which was described as in a seafood broth with a seaweed (I think) foam and some sort of aioli. Mmm we were excited. The dish, however, was trying way too hard. Although very artful it was a molecular gastronomic disappointment. The seafood "broth" was more of a gooey paste at odds with dabs of an angry chipotle sauce and yellow boring mayonnaise; the thin foam had as much flavor as a glass of aqua con gas; worse, the "foam" was dampening in a few minutes what was probably once crispy fish skin; the fish underneath was slightly undercooked and bland. A few dense fingerling potatoes rolled around on the plate in a blind quest for some salt. The dish was also lukewarm. It was a fail.  Needless to say we did not finish the dish. Surly waiter came back, asked us how it was, and we tried hard to be nice. He was not pleased. Neither were we!!! We passed on dessert. The check returned, inclusive of the unfinished pigs ears.  We are from New York City and we are not gastronomic neophytes. Plus, we travel a ton. We know what's going on in the food world (btw, foams are so five years ago!). Aside from the lackluster food, what really got us was how rude the waiter was. He knew we were unhappy, and with a few simple gestures he could have easily turned it around. It was just so crappy. So much of Spain and Madrid have fantastic food experiences and this was not one of them. What a waste of a night out.

review_preview: Well my oh my this was pleasant. I went here on a recommendation from a client on one of our tours. I liked the name - vaguely meaning cacophony in the Moorish tongue - and the idea that it was a family run Riojan bar....
review_full: Well my oh my this was pleasant. I went here on a recommendation from a client on one of our tours. I liked the name - vaguely meaning cacophony in the Moorish tongue - and the idea that it was a family run Riojan bar. I. Love. La. Rioja. So I took my friend and his partner there for a birthday lunch.  We stayed for about an hour and a half or more. The lady running, and I'm disappointed I've forgotten her name - lots of good wine, which by the way is unique to their bar and comes from David Moreno's estate - was a chirpy and bolshy Riojan lady who talked to us, joked with us, and made us feel like we were in her home. Her sister, who came out a little later from the kitchen, was equally as pleasant and passionate about the food they were serving.  The food then: we were served some creative free little tapas first and then moved on to the ordered food. Delightful sticks of asparagus wrapped in a crunchy coating served with a mojo picon sauce. Delicious and light. Then the best croquetas I have ever had. Small yes, but so creamy and made with red shrimp. Then I opted for the chumarro - a whole sliced and perfectly grilled pork loin - served with caramelised onions. Light and fragrant and meaty. Perfectly cooked.  The desserts were nice enough, a sort of toffee thing on an apple thing and a decadent dark chocolate slice. I can't remember to be honest. I was having too much of a good time by that point. Price. A little high, not crazy, for the portion size. But the quality spoke for itself.  This is not a place for a casual lunch. This is something a little nicer, a little more special. A place for a romantic dinner or a celebration or a time when you fancy something with a touch of class.  Really very good indeed.

title_review: High hopes but a bit of a let down
review_preview: Researched steakhouses in Madrid close to the hotel that we were stopping at, the reviews of this one seemed quite good.Initial impressions were great, nice interior and able to watch them cooking the steak from the window, unfortunately that is where it ended for...
review_full: Researched steakhouses in Madrid close to the hotel that we were stopping at, the reviews of this one seemed quite good. Initial impressions were great, nice interior and able to watch them cooking the steak from the window, unfortunately that is where it ended for me. My wife and I both ordered the filet steak cooked medium, mine was almost blue at one end and medium rare for the rest, I can manage medium rare and had eaten most of the steak before getting to the undercooked part, my wife's was exactly the same. The meat tastes nice and the baked potatoes were lovely. We were not asked at any point during our meal how the food was which is in my opinion very unusual and even more so we were disappointed not to be offered desert and when we eventually asked for the bill the waitress walked over and pretty much dumped it on the table, again not asking if we had enjoyed our visit. Needless to say our €93 bill was topped up with a €0.5 tip. Would I go back ??? Probably not after this experience, would I recommend, I guess so as surely this can not be the experience that every visitor will have.

title_review: An Americano Bar in Madrid: cocktails
review_preview: As one of the signs that Madrid is getting mature in the restaurant & drinking scene is bars like Angelita Madrid. Located in one of the busiest areas in Madrid but hidden in Calle Reina, Angelita Madrid has two floors, upper floor is for having...
review_full: As one of the signs that Madrid is getting mature in the restaurant & drinking scene is bars like Angelita Madrid. Located in one of the busiest areas in Madrid but hidden in Calle Reina, Angelita Madrid has two floors, upper floor is for having a bite and wine and downstairs you have the bar, that has a very original cocktail menu with classic cocktails with a special touch and signature cocktails. All of them are originally presented and superbly executed. I recommend the gin tonics. Music is low and pleasant, there are comfortable sofas. So this type of places are becoming more usual in a city where bars were about quantity not quality. A must if you are in Madrid and you are into cocktails.

The food upstairs was top notch and one of the highlights of our trip, a multicourse meal that was both filling and absolutely outstanding. The service here is worth noting. Servers here were attentive without being overbearing and extraordinarily friendly. Really contributed to the overall experience. Downstairs is a cocktail lounge that is definitely worth checking out after your meal. There's a great selection of drinks on the menu plus popcorn and chocolate to nibble on while you're drinking. Atmosphere is very chill and there are numerous couches for you to sit on and unwind. Really enjoyed this place a lot.

review_preview: This small, pretty restaurant not far from Gran Via and Hortaleza has amazing food and tons of modern wines by the glass, plus many bottles including some old vintages.  Run by three brothers, each with a specialty (wine, food or cocktails), the quality of the...
review_full: This small, pretty restaurant not far from Gran Via and Hortaleza has amazing food and tons of modern wines by the glass, plus many bottles including some old vintages. Run by three brothers, each with a specialty (wine, food or cocktails), the quality of the food and especially the fresh produce, stands out. Tomatoes from the family garden, carefully prepared with olive oil, herbs and small bits of salty sardine (if you like), were fantastic. Roast pork shoulder was amazing. And the wines really set Angelita apart. With a selection of un-sulfured wines and old vintages from around Spain and a few other countries, the ability to try a range of styles and ages by the glass is quite special. Wonderful ambience, with high ceilings and tall windows make it a welcoming, calm, happy space. Oh, and there's a hip bar downstairs with music and cocktails into the late hours (well, until 2am, when the clubs get going or your pillow calls you).

review_preview: I went several times for dinner in August.  It's a unique experience.  The cozy dining has a casual, ramshackle, informal elegance to it.  The food is top-notch:  the bright, sassy, warmly welcoming, and riotously funny sisters who run this restaurant (Isabel in the dining room,...
review_full: I went several times for dinner in August. It's a unique experience. The cozy dining has a casual, ramshackle, informal elegance to it. The food is top-notch: the bright, sassy, warmly welcoming, and riotously funny sisters who run this restaurant (Isabel in the dining room, Pilar in the kitchen) like to think of it as traditional food from the Rioja. And it is certainly that, backed up by absolute freshness and care in preparation. But this is to do Pilar's cooking a disservice: she brings a creative touch to everything she makes, drawing freely on other Spanish culinary traditions (the Catalan romesco sauce with the divine batter-fried asparagus spears) and on her own inventiveness (a rice pudding that's almost mousse-like in its lightness because she puts the the grains of rice through a grinder--ask Isabel to tell you the story of why Pilar came up with that twist). A delightful, very Madrilene combination of wit, warmth, tradition, and innovation.

review_preview: Let's get one thing out of the way when reviewing restaurants in Madrid: The design and service will always be implacable, it's just something you come to expect from good restaurants in this city. Arguably, Algarabia (loud joy in Arabic) takes it to a whole...
review_full: Let's get one thing out of the way when reviewing restaurants in Madrid: The design and service will always be implacable, it's just something you come to expect from good restaurants in this city.  Arguably, Algarabia (loud joy in Arabic) takes it to a whole new level. Charming doesn't even begin to describe it. It's an experience on its own.  The food, however, is average. The Asparagus were brilliant but the croquettes were mediocre. The oxtail was amazing but the pasta was nothing to write home about, and the crunchy chocolate cake was simply awful.  So, where all that leaves us? Sadly to say, right in the middle. It's a unique experience, but in this price range, and especially in a city like Madrid which is dirty cheep, this is nice but probably not enough.

We were superbly looked after. Lovely amuse bouche (2 off), great house Rioja and lovely food from the starters (Cured Venison salad, White beans with mushrooms), main course and pudding (rice pudding mouse). The chef came out and chatted to each table (despite our lack of Spanish). A great end to our stay in Madrid. Thank you Algarabia!

title_review: Home cooked food in a homely sitting
review_preview: This was a pleasant, unexpected surprise! I went to this place based on the rating and number of reviews here (but did not actually read any of them). The homely setting, the lovely and personal service by the sisters duo, the good, home cooked food...
review_full: This was a pleasant, unexpected surprise! I went to this place based on the rating and number of reviews here (but did not actually read any of them). The homely setting, the lovely and personal service by the sisters duo, the good, home cooked food and the house wine from Rioja (which is the region from where the sisters are) - all was a great, unforgettable experience.  I got the Oxtail stew - tasty, well cooked fall-off-the-bone meat and hearty. I also got the complimentary pate to begin with - that was yummy too - warm and tasty. The house wine was very good - medium bodied and smooth. I ended with a complimentary glass of harvest(?) wine from Rioja. Overall - very nice place for a different Madrid experience.

From the fresh mushrooms to the Tuna entrees; We found the food to be perfection on a plate. (And don't forget to get his homemade bread to have with dinner). His selections for sherry after dinner was a great finish! One of the great restaurants in our travels around the world!

The whole experience was amazing and I cannot wait to return!

title_review: Fantastic food and authentic, intimate dining in the heart of Madrid.
review_preview: During a recent five night stay in Madrid, and on our first night proper, we were guided, thanks to Tripadvisor, to the welcoming gastronomic comfort of Algarabia.Owned and run by two experienced and charming sisters, the décor is definitely ‘homely’ and the surroundings intimate....
review_full: During a recent five night stay in Madrid, and on our first night proper, we were guided, thanks to Tripadvisor, to the welcoming gastronomic comfort of Algarabia. Owned and run by two experienced and charming sisters, the décor is definitely ‘homely’ and the surroundings intimate. The menu, however, shines; including exciting options for the adventurous whilst also accommodating the more conservative diner. The food is authentic, well-flavoured and fulfilling and the wine offerings were excellent.  Ultimately, we enjoyed a very personal, genuine dining experience, served and hosted by two extremely personable and skilled ladies. A definite must when in Madrid.

review_preview: We had such fond memories of the evening we spent with Pilar and Isabel at Algarabia our last time in Madrid that we decided to dine there again on our first and last evenings in Madrid. We walked from our apartment on a very cold...
review_full: We had such fond memories of the evening we spent with Pilar and Isabel at Algarabia our last time in Madrid that we decided to dine there again on our first and last evenings in Madrid. We walked from our apartment on a very cold but clear night, past the resplendant Royal Palace and Teatro Real, both virtually at the restaurant's doorstep. As we stepped inside the always stylish and beautiful Isabel welcomed us with a warm embrace and a kiss on both cheeks reminding us why we were so looking forward to our return visit..Isabel even remembered to seat us at the same table for two by the window! Pilar, busy working her magic in kitchen, stuck her head out and blew us a kiss as we settled in for another wonderful evening in Rioja. Many of our favorites were still on the menu such as Pilar's signature Rabo de Toro and the exquisite Trigueros Crujientes, along with new dishes such as the Salad with Boar Sausage and the Rabbit Ragout, a marvelously light and succulent take on Ragout a la Bolognese. Algarabia's David Moreno Rioja is smooth and elegant and pairs wonderfully with the Rioja cuisine. The mood is quiet and ever so romantic. The restaurant's setting in the parlor of an old Madrileño house exudes warmth and elegance, a perfect combination of mood, Rioja and great food. Later (much later, this is Madrid) Pilar joined us for a glass of wine at our table and we chatted like old friends before enjoying dessert and 'chupitos' of their wonderful herb Aguardiente. Algarabia remains our favorite restaurant not just in Madrid but in all of Spain. When in Madrid, come to Algarabia and let Pilar and Isabel take you on a delicious journey to Rioja ... Mil gracias chicas, hasta la proxima!

review_preview: For the past 8 years I've been struggling to find a place in Madrid where I could have: A Pizza.There are very few Italian restaurants in the city and I consider none of them have managed to make a decent Pizza.I finally found...
review_full: For the past 8 years I've been struggling to find a place in Madrid where I could have: A Pizza. There are very few Italian restaurants in the city and I consider none of them have managed to make a decent Pizza. I finally found the place for Pizzas in Madrid and that is La Pizzateca. Perfect combination: great product cooked with passion and well as great service. It reminds me of dining in New York city, you get the best Pizzas and the best service. You pay according to the product you are having, 10 to 11 Euros for the great Pizza in Madrid. My wife had the lazagna which she considered superb, tiramisu was also great, good selection of exotic beers, and again the best Pizza I have had in years. Ambient is fresh, owner/chef is a real cuisine artist, and I'm ready to meet the next La Pizzateca in other areas of Madrid. We will definitely come again. Cheers

review_preview: Restaurant run by 2 sisters, with a passion for good cooking and good service. After explanation of the menu by Isabel, we chose the chef's menu, consisting of 2 starters, 2 main courses and a desert to surprise us. We also ordered a rioja vino...
review_full: Restaurant run by 2 sisters, with a passion for good cooking and good service. After explanation of the menu by Isabel, we chose the chef's menu, consisting of 2 starters, 2 main courses and a desert to surprise us. We also ordered a rioja vino tinto, which comes from David Moreno estate and is bottled for the restaurant. While waiting for the food, we were served with small tapas of artichoke leaves with tomatoes and olive oil sauce, a small soup with white beans, and a liver pate with crostini. All very good. Starters consisted of the red shrimp croquetas (not to miss) and pastry wrapped green asparagus. Main course was cod riojana style, and pork tenderloin with caramelised onions. Everything was perfectly cooked, and tasted absolutely delicious. As a dessert, we were given a mascarapone and pear tart, and a chocolate tart with raspberries, both very good. Sisters make sure all the time that you are enjoying the food and the service, with personalised attention. If you are looking for genuine home style cooking served in a welcoming atmosphere, then make sure you visit this restaurant in Madrid.

review_preview: Situated up a short side street close to the Royal Palace,this small restaurant (about 7 or 8 tables) is run by 2 sisters.Pilar cooks fantastic food and Isabel provides front of house duties.It is what i would call a traditional spanish restaurant.There is an english...
review_full: Situated up a short side street close to the Royal Palace,this small restaurant (about 7 or 8 tables) is run by 2 sisters.Pilar cooks fantastic food and Isabel provides front of house duties.It is what i would call a traditional spanish restaurant.There is an english version of the menu,but Isabel will explain more about the dishes to you if required.The choice of dishes is quite varied.I chose pork loin with caramelized onions for my main course whilst my wife had a pasta dish.Bread comes with your meal (normal in Madrid restaurants).We were given a complimentary pate and toast and a biscuit with some fish on them whilst we waited for our food. Pilar came out of the kitchen at the end and chatted to us for a while (not understanding each others language we got by however). It happened to be her birthday so everybody gave her their "happy returns".We enjoyed our meals,the experience,and the friendly atmosphere created by the owners.Make sure you book before you go!!!

We were looking forward to having excellent authentic Spanish cuisine while we were in Madrid and we were not disappointed. Having dinner in Algarabia was one of the highlights of our holiday in Madrid.

review_preview: I wanted to take a visiting American family for a "local" dining experience and tried Algarabia (based on Tripadvisor reviews).  Pilar and Isabel, the two charming sisters behind the place, treated us like family and we had a memorable evening.  This is a quiet small...
review_full: I wanted to take a visiting American family for a "local" dining experience and tried Algarabia (based on Tripadvisor reviews). Pilar and Isabel, the two charming sisters behind the place, treated us like family and we had a memorable evening. This is a quiet small restaurant with a very homelike feeling.  The food is northern Spanish and a goes a bit further in terms of sauces and creativity than the standard Madrid fare. The menu is not large, but there are daily specials which change. To be honest, between the chatter and Rioja, I can't remember precisely what everyone ate, but it did span from seafood to duck and we all enjoyed what we ordered. I'd say it was moderately priced and good value for the money. I'll definitely return.

Caprese muy buena con tomates frescos que parecen del huerto y mozzarella de alta calidad. Hay un pequeño error en las servilletas. Los tomates que muestran en el diseño NO son San Marzano ya que aquellos (los San Marzano) son largos delgados y con puntito al final. Pone en entredicho si todo lo que te dicen es verdad de verdad?

review_preview: Had a few rubbish meals in a row, (had been travelling for 3 weeks already at the time and was tired and over the food at this point), I decided to search trip adviser and check reviews before going anywhere else lol. This place popped...
review_full: Had a few rubbish meals in a row, (had been travelling for 3 weeks already at the time and was tired and over the food at this point), I decided to search trip adviser and check reviews before going anywhere else lol. This place popped up and had great reviews. And I can’t fault it. We went twice during our 3 night stay in Madrid. The first visit we spoke English (we’re Australian) and the staff member (a very polite young man) attending to us had excellent English. While ordering he made recommendations which personally, I love when they do this. (For eg. He suggested I order a bread basket with my meal as it was quite saucy, the bread is good to eat with the sauce once you finish the pasta) he was on point with his recommendations haha and he was extremely friendly and professional the whole time. The atmosphere was friendly and casual, the place itself was modern. The second time we went we spoke in Spanish, the woman serving us was just as polite, the restaurant was a bit busier than the previous visit but the service was still spot on, the meals came out in good time, when we switched to English half way through, so did the young lady without skipping a beat. Our food both visits was delicious, we were completely satisfied by the whole experience both times and I’d highly recommend. (Ps sorry the photos are rubbish lol).

title_review: Terrible service, understaffed will not come back
review_preview: I was so excited to try this place and when I read they had vegan options I was elated. Got to the restaurant and there was a wait, I told the hostess(who is also a server) that I wanted to be added to the list....
review_full: I was so excited to try this place and when I read they had vegan options I was elated. Got to the restaurant and there was a wait, I told the hostess(who is also a server) that I wanted to be added to the list. She informed me there would be a 20 minute wait. I asked if I could sit at the bar she said yes! She didn’t give me a menu or anything. The restaurant for its size wasn’t staffed appropriately. One bartender, 3 servers and no hostess. I sat at the bar watching the bartender sweat while making drinks, this is the first restaurant I’ve been to in Madrid where the wait staff look like they hate their jobs. Finally after waiting at the bar without an acknowledgement or a menu, the bartender asked if I needed something. And I replied with yes I’d like to order food and drinks but I don’t have a menu. He brought one over and blamed the waitress for not letting him know. I made it very easy and asked for a Tinto de verano as my drink. For food I asked what the cheeseless options were and I took his recommendations. I specifically asked for items without cheese. I watched him make my drinks with 90% Fanta and a splash of wine. It was terrible, I didn’t finish it. My pizza came out fine but he ordered me a dish that was covered in cheese. It wasn’t until I sent that back that the wait staff started to be nice to me. I hadn’t eaten all day and you would expect this to be the most amazing pizza ever. It wasn’t. I even heard other tables complain/comment “this better be the best pizza I’ve ever had.” At the bar I asked the bartender if I could pay he heard me but ignored my request since he was so slammed. It wasn’t until I got out of my seat that he went and got the terminal to charge my card. The whole experience was complete and utter garbage. Never again.

title_review: Best steak restaurant we've ever visited!!
review_preview: I booked to visit this restaurant recently for my partners birthday. Neither of us had ever been before but after seeing the reviews online we decided to give it a go. Our reservation was for 8pm and when we arrived the place was relatively quiet,...
review_full: I booked to visit this restaurant recently for my partners birthday. Neither of us had ever been before but after seeing the reviews online we decided to give it a go.  Our reservation was for 8pm and when we arrived the place was relatively quiet, which soon changed as people started arriving for their evening meal. I ordered the beef tenderloin with peppercorn sauce and my partner had the 500g ribeye.  The steaks were cooked to perfection, after hearing they tended to come slightly rare we opted for medium which was cooked beautifully, you could practically cut them with your spoon . There was no fat or gristle just soft, brilliantly seasoned meat and the fries (I had the garlic and parsley ones) went fantastically. Paired with a glass of red wine I can honestly say it was the best meal I've ever had.  The staff were excellent and switched between Spanish and English with no hesitation and the whole place had a relaxed yet vibrant atmosphere.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting.

title_review: Some of the best pizza I've ever had
review_preview: My mother and I came here late in the evening on our first night in Madrid. It was close to the hotel, had great reviews, and we wanted a break from all of the jamon and tapas we'd been eating in Spain. We absolutely loved...
review_full: My mother and I came here late in the evening on our first night in Madrid. It was close to the hotel, had great reviews, and we wanted a break from all of the jamon and tapas we'd been eating in Spain. We absolutely loved it. We ordered the la diavola, a glass of wine, and a small beer. The pizza was so good that we ate the lightly crispy yet slightly chewy crust with no sauce. Anyone who's eaten pizza knows that good crust is not easy to find. Even at good pizzerias you'll see bits of crust left on the table. But here our pizza was perfectly cooked and we ate every last bit of it. In fact, we loved the food there so much that we came back 2 nights later! And for a second time, we had an excellent pizza that was cooked to perfection. But what makes this awesome little pizza joint so great is how reasonably priced it was!  So if you're looking for a spot to grab a relatively cheap but great pizza, come here!

A great pit stop when you want to keep seeing the town, but are very hungry.

review_preview: Ate here our first night in Madrid. The staff were lovely and it wasn’t too busy when we arrived around 7.30pm. We didn’t need to book but it did get busy later on in the evening. Wine was very reasonably priced €3.00 for a glass!...
review_full: Ate here our first night in Madrid. The staff were lovely and it wasn’t too busy when we arrived around 7.30pm. We didn’t need to book but it did get busy later on in the evening.  Wine was very reasonably priced €3.00 for a glass! However, spirits were much more expensive. This is probably more common for the area though!  The menu has a great selection. We opted for the argentine sausage which was delicious and the provolone cheese (we had this just to try but really didn’t enjoy it as it was quite oily).  For mains we both had the ribeye steak which was cooked perfectly and so tasty.  The only downsides to this restaurant is that there is no steak sauces on the menu so I’m not sure if they have any. You also have to order all your sides separately. So €23 only gets you the steak, there’s more cost for sides and there’s not a great selection. I would have really appreciated a side salad along with the steak but all you get is 3 cherry tomatoes. Overall a lovely restaurant in a great location from our hotel.

review_preview: The steaks we ordered were excellent. It’s definitely slightly pricier but you need to order something that you will like to eat; don’t get the cheap cuts if you want to be safe. The tenderloin I had was very very succulent. In comparison, I found...
review_full: The steaks we ordered were excellent. It’s definitely slightly pricier but you need to order something that you will like to eat; don’t get the cheap cuts if you want to be safe.  The tenderloin I had was very very succulent. In comparison, I found the rib eye not to my likings as it was a bit chewy. Love the salad and the rum pancake is a must!  I felt they charged decent price to be honest, it was a large cut and it was grilled to perfection. Not sure why would one complain about their price because I felt it was worth it. For the same kind of quality you probably can’t get it in many places so I’m actually contented.  Service is however rather poor. The waitress who served us was sulking the whole afternoon. Towards the end of our meal she finally smiled a little bit more. Oh well I guess it’s just her bad day.

review_preview: The food was OK but not great, and this restaurant is very overpriced. They also rip you off by giving you bread without asking you if you want it then charging you €1.90 per person for it. We didn’t want the bread, didn’t ask for...
review_full: The food was OK but not great, and this restaurant is very overpriced. They also rip you off by giving you bread without asking you if you want it then charging you €1.90 per person for it. We didn’t want the bread, didn’t ask for it, we were never asked if we wanted it and we didn’t eat any of it. It was just plopped on our table by a passing waiter so we didn’t even have a chance to say we didn’t want it. Definitely felt like a scam and although it was only a couple of euros each, given the meal was already overpriced, this place is obviously a tourist trap. When I complained about being charged for bread we didn’t want, the manager kept arguing that it’s normal in Spain. In our experience, this is not the case. They should at least ask you if you want the bread as in a lot of other restaurants (in Spain and other European countries) they don’t charge extra for bread, and if they do, they will ask you if you want bread or only bring it if you order it

review_full: So we chose this place based on reviews and our location that evening (not too far from Retiro Park where we went for a long walk that evening). The food was excellent and the staff were very friendly and spoke good English. A thing to note beyond the Spanish eating lunch and dinner later than most of us are used to doing is that restaurants that close after lunch and re-open at dinner don't really open early or even right on time. If they open at 7:00, you should expect on going around 7:10-7:15. We went at 7:00 and visited a couple tourist shops on the street (very eclectic shops on this street) and around 7:15 went to eat and were the first to walk in. We had a serving of the fried mozzarella and it was fabulous (although not healthy at all I imagine) and a couple pizzas. It was excellent pizza and better than any pizza I've had in Europe outside of Italy. Fair prices and, as I mentioned, friendly and attentive staff. Highly recommend the place.

title_review: Some of the best pizza we have ever had, even in Italy
review_preview: After some lazy nights eating preservative-laden sandwiches from the local VIPS, we were looking for something to take to the hotel in walking distance and not croquetas or bocadillos de jamon again. Looking at the map, we found this place and got the Napoletana (anchovies,...
review_full: After some lazy nights eating preservative-laden sandwiches from the local VIPS, we were looking for something to take to the hotel in walking distance and not croquetas or bocadillos de jamon again. Looking at the map, we found this place and got the Napoletana (anchovies, black olives, cheese, tomatoes, oregano). It was terrific, probably better than any other pizza we have had in terms of pure flavor, including those we've had in various spots all over Italy. The crust is a tad thicker and less wet than Italian pizza, and the toppings were of the perfect amount--not too much like in the US and not as minimalistic as in some Italian places. We will return at least once more for the Romana (with roasted potatoes). There's a deal of two portions of whatever selections are available that night and a drink for around 6 euros and one can get whole pies from 7 to around 9 euros..

review_preview: From the outside this looks like a fairly ordinary small shop selling squares of takeaway pizza. Yes it does sell good quality takeaway pizza but past the counter you can also find a delightful, bright, small restaurant area. In the restaurant you can choose the...
review_full: From the outside this looks like a fairly ordinary small shop selling squares of takeaway pizza. Yes it does sell good quality takeaway pizza but past the counter you can also find a delightful, bright, small restaurant area. In the restaurant you can choose the pizza on show in the shop and there is also an extensive separate menu mainly featuring pizza but with a few other choices.  The reason to go here is the excellent quality of the pizza. We cannot ever remember such a light and crispy crust, and from the restaurant you can partly see the kitchen where everything is clearly prepared with great care and attention resulting in a delicious meal. Wine also decent and good value.  We ate here 3 nights during a 6 night stay in Madrid. Given the practise in Madrid that you almost always get a snack with any drinks you buy in a bar it was a great way to start the night sharing a pizza and a bottle of wine (for about 20 euros) without ever getting over full. Finally all of the staff we met - waiters, cook and the manager - were super friendly and efficient.

title_review: They let us in outside of business hours!
review_preview: Feeling really peckish around 6pm, with hours to go before the usual 9pm dining time in Madrid, we stopped by La Pizzateca hoping for a a tasty slice to tide us over. To our disappointment, they were closed (evening hours 7pm - 12am)... But then!...
review_full: Feeling really peckish around 6pm, with hours to go before the usual 9pm dining time in Madrid, we stopped by La Pizzateca hoping for a a tasty slice to tide us over. To our disappointment, they were closed (evening hours 7pm - 12am)... But then! We tried our luck knocking anyway, and when they opened the door and saw our famished faces, they let us in without delay and within a few minutes I was the happy recipient of a truffle mushroom slice, hanger was averted, the evening was saved, they taught us how to properly pronounce the "Calle" in "Calle Leon," and now everyone should try this cute little pizza place with its kind, friendly staff and great-value tasty pizza! :-)

review_preview: I'm a New Yorker, and I know good pizza. Pizzateca has created an original style of their own that is satisfying and delicious. The crust is fantastic and different than those I have had in the past. Thicker than New York style, and about half...
review_full: I'm a New Yorker, and I know good pizza. Pizzateca has created an original style of their own that is satisfying and delicious. The crust is fantastic and different than those I have had in the past. Thicker than New York style, and about half the thickness of Sicilian. The have a nice variety including a mushroom style that was very tasty as was the bolognese. For two generous slices and a soda it came to 6.5 euro. A great way to save some dough and not feel cheated out of the good food Madrid has to offer. They are also open until midnight seven nights a week.

title_review: Fantastic Pizza and great value for money
review_preview: Just came back from our second visit here - and really pleased again by the quality, service and value of this little gem.Had the tasting place of 3 large squares (each cut into 2 slices each) of 3 different pizzas - ie 6 slices...
review_full: Just came back from our second visit here - and really pleased again by the quality, service and value of this little gem. Had the tasting place of 3 large squares (each cut into 2 slices each) of 3 different pizzas - ie 6 slices in total. Had the five cheese, the mushroom and cheese , and the fresh tomato, buffalo mozzarella & basil pizzas - all were excellent and the crusts are fantastic. Accompanied the tasting plate with a medium lager beer and a glass of red wine. Total cost was less than €14 - great value for excellent food. Furthermore - the staff were very friendly and spoke great English. Highly recommend this pizzeria to anyone visiting Madrid. Brian & Marylou Darwin , Australia

title_review: Best Pizza I've Had in Madrid to Date
review_preview: I've been in Madrid 4 months now, and this is by far the best and most authentic pizza I've found. Located just a few steps away from the Anton Martin metro stop on linea 1, this restaurant offers a variety of delicious gourmet pizzas at...
review_full: I've been in Madrid 4 months now, and this is by far the best and most authentic pizza I've found. Located just a few steps away from the Anton Martin metro stop on linea 1, this restaurant offers a variety of delicious gourmet pizzas at an affordable price. One full pie, which I ate myself, cost 9 euros. For 9.50 they also have the option to split your pizza half and half (half one style/toppings, half another). title_review: Good for simple /elegant meal - would have liked more contrast in flavors
review_preview: I went here based on the trip advisor reviews.  First off:  the service and decor were lovely.  The food was really well prepared, but flavors seemed a bit of one note.The menu looked really interesting - we tried a tomato salad, pig ear and...
review_full: I went here based on the trip advisor reviews. First off: the service and decor were lovely. The food was really well prepared, but flavors seemed a bit of one note. The menu looked really interesting - we tried a tomato salad, pig ear and sea bass. They sent a complimentary salmon tartare that was over the top. If i could have ordered that as an app, i would have. It had salt and JALEPENO!!!! I realized i had been missing heat in my food and this was spectacular. The flavors were balanced, and well contrasted, yum. So, my expectations were high - the tomato salad - eh. Nice tomatoes, needed something else in flavor contrast. The pigs ear weren't my thing - but i tried them. They were supposed to have a spicy sauce - Crispy, but again, the flavor seemed one note and not spicy. Sea bass was cooked perfectly, but again, no contrast. I really wanted an acid (lemon/vinegar) or an element of surprise.  Maybe we didn't order the right items to show the talent of this place. Clearly they have skill and know what they are doing. If you like a simple well cooked meal, it is worth a try.

title_review: Best pizza this side of the Mediterranean
review_preview: After reading the rave reviews I knew I had to go have some pizza at La Pizzateca. It´s an unassuming place located within a 10 minute walk from the Center of Madrid. It sits 5 to 6 people so it´s best to get your pizza...
review_full: After reading the rave reviews I knew I had to go have some pizza at La Pizzateca. It´s an unassuming place located within a 10 minute walk from the Center of Madrid. It sits 5 to 6 people so it´s best to get your pizza to go and eat outside now that the weather is nice.  You can either get a whole pie made for you (have to wait 15 minutes or so) or eat one of their pre-made slices that they will graciously heat in the pizza oven. We went for the 2 slices + beverage combo each and we ended up with quite a lot of pizza to eat. The crust was thick, crunchy and had a great hand made flavor. They had quite a variety of flavors so we got one of each: arugula, goat cheese and balsamic pizza, 5 cheese pizza, mushroom and truffle oil pizza, sweet onions and bacon... They were all delicious and the price was unbeatable. 6 slices (each slice is split in halves so you end up with 12 small portions) + 3 bevarages: 20 Euros. My girlfriend complained that we had to wait a bit for the pizzas to heat but it wasn´t an issue for me.  If you are craving a slice of pizza do yourself a favor and drag your behind to this place, it will be worth it.

title_review: Best meal in Madrid - very memorable
review_preview: Compared to other parts of Spain, Madrid can feel more expensive. But then you don't mind paying more if the meal is truly special. A meal at Angelita is just this!Visiting Madrid a couple of weeks ago with my husband and father in law,...
review_full: Compared to other parts of Spain, Madrid can feel more expensive. But then you don't mind paying more if the meal is truly special. A meal at Angelita is just this! Visiting Madrid a couple of weeks ago with my husband and father in law, we tried our luck to get a table on a Friday night. The restaurant was fully booked, but they had space at the bar. We ordered several dishes to share, as well as wine to accompany. The food - incredible. The vegetable dishes were incredibly tasty and the meat dishes cooked to perfection. The presentation of the food was very photo worthy! The wine list is extensive and the staff are readily available to suggest what might go well with your dishes. We opted for the cheese board for desert - what a lovely experience! We were invited to the cheese trolley where one of the team talked through each and every cheese, helping us to pick a selection. One of the ladies at the bar then helped us pick a desert wine to match. The staff/team who work at this restaurant are simply brilliant. Attention to detail, knowledge of dishes, wine etc really impressive. We had a throughly enjoyable evening, not just because the food was simply delicious, but because the whole atmosphere and experience at Angelita meant that for days afterwards we were talking about how much we had enjoyed it. Yes slightly more expensive, but yes definitely worth it. Be sure to book though!

title_review: Great place with a unique menu concept
review_preview: This restaurant is pretty tiny (only 11 or 12 tables) so it's worth arriving early evening when they open at 8ish to avoid disappointment, as half of those tables were already  booked-out the night we visited. The staff are really friendly and welcoming and provide...
review_full: This restaurant is pretty tiny (only 11 or 12 tables) so it's worth arriving early evening when they open at 8ish to avoid disappointment, as half of those tables were already booked-out the night we visited. The staff are really friendly and welcoming and provide English menus if required. The menu itself is divided into 5 veggie, 5 meat, 5 fish dishes and 5 desserts, and you can either order full portions, half portions or tapas portions. This is a great idea, as it makes it possible to enjoy many of the delights on offer, regardless of how hungry you are, and the waitress was happy to advise us on how much food we should order. Every dish that came was simply delicious, and I was surprised (not to mention slightly disappointed!) that 'half portions' would fill me up so much that I wouldn't be able to fit in my favourite part of any meal - the dessert! The final bill came to less than €26 between two of us - amazing value!! Can't recommend this place enough if you're looking for great value, simple cuisine that's cooked to perfection, in a friendly, laid-back place. If I ever find myself in Madrid again, I'll be seeking Taberna Origen out again for sure.

The food is always wonderful, whatever you get; the wine is always delicious and by USA-standards inexpensive; the hospitality is always warm and welcoming. Our favorite waiter Miguel is still there, still remembers my wife's favorite wines and, like the other great MB hosts, doesn't even roll his eyes when gangs of girls come in to take selfies with and get kisses from MB's brilliant young celebrity chef. Highly recommended if you're anywhere near the endless eateries near the Plaza Mayor.

review_preview: Having travelled in Spain for a week or so, we had really only had Tapas for dinner. We were looking for a restaurant to have a "proper" meal, and also away from the street and all the hawkers and tourists. This quaint restaurant just off...
review_full: Having travelled in Spain for a week or so, we had really only had Tapas for dinner. We were looking for a restaurant to have a "proper" meal, and also away from the street and all the hawkers and tourists. This quaint restaurant just off Plaza Mayor was perfect. Even though we arrived well before dinner time (at 7.03pm), the restaurant was open and welcoming. We were offered complimentary celery mojito shots and bread with artisan butter. What a treat! We ordered some hummus and pita bread to share which was very generous in size and delicious. Our meals were amazing: suckling pig with quince jam; lamb gigot; beef sirloin with potatoes au gratin. Each meal was delicious and perfectly balanced. We shared the chocolate dessert which is a delight and not to be missed, but maybe too much for one person! Service was fabulous and no Spanish (only English) was no problem. HIGHLY Recommended!

review_preview: This was our last meal in Madrid and it definitely lived up to its reviews! Food - Excellent. The squid in ali oli sauce was very fresh and tasty; The scallops were very fresh but we didn't love the sauce as much because we preferred...
review_full: This was our last meal in Madrid and it definitely lived up to its reviews!  Food - Excellent. The squid in ali oli sauce was very fresh and tasty; The scallops were very fresh but we didn't love the sauce as much because we preferred it savoury than sweet; The noodle paella was amazing but we would recommend not having it with cream in order to experience the taste and texture better; The min lamb burger was delicious and went perfectly with the mint sauce; The suckling pig was tender and crispy with full of flavour; and our tangerine dessert was the perfect way to end the meal with a citrus tinge. We also got free champagne because the restaurant was celebrating their 3rd anniversary!  Service - Excellent. The waiters were all polite and friendly; there was a slight language barrier but it wasn't a problem at all as the menu was in English. Atmosphere - Very good. Not the perfect place for a quiet meal, but definitely a good place for meeting up with friends to catch up. Overall - This was one of the best meals we had in Madrid! Definitely worth a try!!

review_preview: Read a review of Taberna Origen and just had to try it. The fact that it is, literally, right next door to where we are staying only cemented this plan. We were greeted in an extremely friendly way and that feeling continued during our entire...
review_full: Read a review of Taberna Origen and just had to try it. The fact that it is, literally, right next door to where we are staying only cemented this plan. We were greeted in an extremely friendly way and that feeling continued during our entire visit. The food was original and delicious. The vegetable tempura was light and delicious. The tuna tartare was flavorful and the accompanying avocado ice cream was amazing. Every dish we had was outstanding and I would love to go back and try many more. My 12-year-old and I both loved it. His favorite was the tempura and his dessert of cinnamon ice cream. I loved the stuffed tomato, avocado ice cream, tuna tartare and the crusty fresh bread. My only disappointment was the tinto which was too light for me. But the man who recommended and served it was so charming, I didn't even mind that! We will go back - maybe even more than once even though we are only here for another week.

I really wanted to try this place out, but I guess they just didn't care to have the business or something. Very strange experience. Just a heads up to people traveling. Might not be the best place to plan ahead to go eat there since they don't honor reservations.

review_preview: I went to this tapas bar thanks to Tripadvisor for a dinner on saturday night. Luckily we arrived around 8.30 pm when the restaurant was about to open, because after 9.30 pm it got really crowd and every table was occupied. So my first recommendation...
review_full: I went to this tapas bar thanks to Tripadvisor for a dinner on saturday night.  Luckily we arrived around 8.30 pm when the restaurant was about to open, because after 9.30 pm it got really crowd and every table was occupied. So my first recommendation here is that if you are a group of people, it's better to get the reservation right away or just arrive early.  Located in a quiet street with nothing nearby, it seemed like the place is well known by the locals. It looks normal, nothing pretentious. But it is really at its best! However, the staffs were very friendly and attentive. They attended us with smiley face and very calm, unlike other typical spanish bar. They provide a menu in english and spanish (all the dishes and drinks). So if you don't speak spanish, it won't be a problem to order. Taberna Origen offers a selection of dishes, dividing into three sections: from the sea, the vegetable, and the earth. So the variety is limited, but trust me… regardless the number of dishes offered, they are all beautifully presented and from my own experience (I have tried 5)… all are well cooked and designed. The quality prevails over the quantity! Another good thing of this place is that they let you choose the size: full portion, half portion and tapas portion with different prices. This allows you to try different dishes. We were two and we ordered 5 of half-portion dishes and a dessert. A bit way too much.  We tried out:  - Cuttlefish burger with alioli of yuzu and arugula (6.5 euros) - for half portion and it came with 2 burgers, perfect for us, since we were 2!. The cuttlefish burger was great. The alioli blew me away.  - Meat mini burgers- the meat was perfectly cooked (6.5 euros), regardless it is very normal dishes, they are able to make it different!; - Rabo de toro (ox tail) - very tender and tasty (7.00 euros);  - Tartare of tuna with avocado ice-cream - the touch of sesame oil makes it to the top of my list. What a great combination of flavours! (9.00 euros); - Iberian cheeks with yucca chips - the sauce was great. The cheek was very soft and absorbed all the sauce. Yucca chips were a great idea to combine with the cheek (7.00 euros).  For the dessert: we were actually very full but my friend was like to try so we shared chocolate coulant with violet ice-cream (4.5 euros) - the coulant was light but very chocolatey. However, it is not cloying which is ideal! Violet ice-cream was creamy, rich in violet but not so sweet, so it adds a little freshness to the dish. I was full but I enjoyed it until my very last bite! The drinks were at reasonable price. I ordered a glass of Cava (3 euros) and two bottle of water (1.5 euro each). We ended up paying 46.50 euros for two and were about to explode by the time we leave. I would say that if you order reasonably, it should cost roughly 15-20 euros per person. :D During lunch time they do offer 2 tapas-size dishes (anything from the menu) with a dessert or coffee and a glass beer/ house wine for 7.95 euros. This is a hidden gem in Madrid. It's not so far from the city centre and it is walkable from Princesa Shopping Street and Plaza de España. So if you wanna try a modern spanish tapas with a lot of idea and love in it, you can't miss this place. I have had a great time there and definitely will go back!

review_full: We (a group of 9 friends studying abroad in Spain) wandered over to La Pizzateca a little before it opened. The woman working there saw us standing outside and let us know that they'd be ready for us in 5 minutes. I was starving, tired, and overheated, so this was reassuring. Sure enough, 5 minutes later she let us in. She patiently explained each type of unconventional pizza (a nice change!) in the display multiple times to each of us before quickly grabbing our orders and popping each slice into the oven to warm up. She brought the pizza to our table promptly, and it was absolutely delicious!! I was worried about my 15 Euro budget, but it was only about 6 Euros for 2 large slices (got to sample 2 diff flavors!) and a drink. I was full and saved money! When it was time to pay, she efficiently gave separate checks. The bathroom was clean, and there was even a place to charge up my phone. I left satisfied - full, rested, and cooled. Would definitely recommend and come back again!

title_review: Not only an excellent steak house but an excellent dining experience
review_preview: This is the best steak experience you can find and one of the best restaurant experiences I have had. There is real theatre with the Parrilla fired up with Argentinian charcoal. Our host assured us that it burns hotter leaving a sweater taste to the...
review_full: This is the best steak experience you can find and one of the best restaurant experiences I have had. There is real theatre with the Parrilla fired up with Argentinian charcoal. Our host assured us that it burns hotter leaving a sweater taste to the meat. To start, the Empanadas were very light with nicely spiced meat fillings. The Asado provided the main event with a great selection of the best Argentinian Aberdeen Angus steaks, I recommend the rib eye. In addition there was a good selection of chicken dishes.  Although none of our party sampled this dish, the selection of Argentinian meats served on a hot plate looked to be a very popular choice. The meal was rounded off with an excellent Malbec and Tiramisu. In addition to the fantastic food our party of six was very well looked after with all courses arriving at the same time. The staff were very attentive. This is already on my list for my next visit to Madrid.

title_review: Madrid - Spain - La Cabana Argentina - Wonderful food and service
review_preview: We had come to Madrid for a friends sixtieth birthday and La Cabana Argentina was booked for her birthday meal and it certainly didn't disappoint. The layout and décor of the place was quite exquisite and our welcome was great from very friendly staff. We...
review_full: We had come to Madrid for a friends sixtieth birthday and La Cabana Argentina was booked for her birthday meal and it certainly didn't disappoint. The layout and décor of the place was quite exquisite and our welcome was great from very friendly staff. We were quickly seated and drinks came quickly after that. As with all of Madrid the spirits and mixers were on the large side. We all plumped for steak and I had a lovely Argentina fillet with a peppered sauce with fries and some salad. it was wonderful, the knife went through it like it was butter. The wives had a pudding which was an experience and very tasty and all throughout the meal there was no hassle or pressure to finish each course. The drinks flowed and we all had a wonderful evening in a superb restaurant. Hats off to everyone at La Cabana and thank you all for making our night, and in particular the birthday girls night, very special indeed.

review_preview: This was the best steak we've had during our 20 months in Spain - by far! We were also thrilled to get proveleta, morcilla, empanadas and chimichuri - all tasted authentic. While we will never tire of Spanish wine, the Argentine Malbec at La Cabana...
review_full: This was the best steak we've had during our 20 months in Spain - by far! We were also thrilled to get proveleta, morcilla, empanadas and chimichuri - all tasted authentic. While we will never tire of Spanish wine, the Argentine Malbec at La Cabana Argentina was a nice change of pace. Our service was good, and the prices were moderate. The only small drawback was the restaurant became noisey as the evening got later. As Americans, we did appreciate being able to have dinner at 7:00 p.m.

title_review: The best Argentinian steak outside of Argentine
review_preview: Although I was already booked for a restaurant for the evening, while passing by in the street around lunchtime, the grill caught my eye. In a very clever way, they located the charcoal grill at the window for all the people in the street to...
review_full: Although I was already booked for a restaurant for the evening, while passing by in the street around lunchtime, the grill caught my eye. In a very clever way, they located the charcoal grill at the window for all the people in the street to see. Indeed this is their forte. I walked in, and booked dinner and immediately canceled my my previous booking. This was no mistake. We were a party of two, my twelve year old son and me. I ordered the sweetbread for a first course for both of us, this was a large portion and grilled just right. we followed this with the rib eye steak accompanied by grilled pepper and cooked vegetables. the steak was excellent. Tender, full of flavor and grilled to perfection. Outstanding. The Grappa lovers should ask for the Orujo. A nice finish to the meal. What a great first night in Madrid!!

title_review: Fresh, modern and pretty good pizza
review_preview: Oven Atocha is a really lovely space, not far from the train station and on the main road it's easy to find.We have a family tradition of Friday night is pizza night, so where-ever we are in the world we try and fit in...
review_full: Oven Atocha is a really lovely space, not far from the train station and on the main road it's easy to find. We have a family tradition of Friday night is pizza night, so where-ever we are in the world we try and fit in a pizza. Some places don't do it very well and others excel.  I wouldn't put Oven in the excel bracket but it's still pretty good, a nice chewy base, maybe a bit too much cheese but a good amount of anchovies on our choice this Friday, sadly it was a bit cold after being left on the pass for too long, we could see it sitting there calling out to us, in the end we motioned to the friendly wait staff who brought it over with an apology.  The salad was great, nice and light and well dressed, so if you're looking for your own Friday night is Pizza night give Oven Atocha a go.

We ordered some bread to start which was very reasonably priced at only €2 and it came out almost immediately. The service was also excellent throughout and the ones who spoke English were particularly helpful when we were ordering. I had a carpaccio and goats cheese pizza which was fantastic. The saltiness of the carpaccio beef and the sweetness of the goats cheese in honey balanced perfectly. My partner had a baked pasta which she said was tasty and cooked nicely. If I had any complaint, it'd be that it's slightly on the pricier side but considering the quality, I was more than happy to pay the prices. Additionally I think Madrid is an expensive place so this probably aligns with similar restaurants

There is nothing labelled as vegetarian/vegan on the menu and the non-meat options were limited so we ordered a vegetable pizza without cheese and aubergine pasta without cheese. They also made a plain pasta dish for our daughter with a simple pomodoro sauce. Although the dishes weren’t very exciting they tasted delicious, particularly the auberginepasta which I’m glad I ordered!  The other advantage is they are open when many restaurants are shut between their lunch and evening service. Very good location too. Special mention to our waiters Rodrigo and Francisco.

title_review: Great Moderate Priced Restaurant for Visitors
review_preview: We wanted a nice, moderately priced restaurant after a long day of visiting local attractions.  When we walked down the street and noticed the menu for the Oven Atocha, we thought it looked interesting and looked very nice inside.  So, we decided to give them...
review_full: We wanted a nice, moderately priced restaurant after a long day of visiting local attractions. When we walked down the street and noticed the menu for the Oven Atocha, we thought it looked interesting and looked very nice inside. So, we decided to give them a try. We found the staff, especially Luisa, Jesu's, and Mano to be very helpful and responsive. Luisa spoke very good English and helped us find a great local wine for my wife and local beer for me. Both were very good and at a very reasonable price. We both selected pizza to eat and were quite pleased with both. They were tasty, a good size, and just the right temperature. We could not be happier with the food, price, and service. Wish we could find it elsewhere at cities we visited while in Spain and in the US!

title_review: Not as vegetarian friendly as they say
review_preview: Went there for a business dinner with large group. I was one of the two vegeterians. Before anything else, lets be clear: the food is good and the staff is friendly. But for a place that claimed to be vegetarian friendly, i was disapointed to...
review_full: Went there for a business dinner with large group. I was one of the two vegeterians. Before anything else, lets be clear: the food is good and the staff is friendly. But for a place that claimed to be vegetarian friendly, i was disapointed to find it is the same story as is so many other places. The main course for those who chose fish or meat was copious, with a generous portion of meat and a reasonable side dish. For the same price, vegetarians got what i would call "only the side dish": a portion of candied vegetables.... topped with a few tiny fish fillets that looked like anchovies (have not tried those). The vegetable were excellent though. Dont claim you are vegetarian friendly if you cant make a balanced main course or if you think vegetarians are either rabbits or on a diet.

title_review: Great food and service, convenient location
review_preview: This was just around the corner from our hotel, and we were craving good Italian food for a change of pace. We couldn’t have done better than Oven. We were greeted warmly and seated immediately, presented with menus and given adequate time to read them...

We were greeted warmly and seated immediately, presented with menus and given adequate time to read them through before we ordered. Their selection is good, with an abundance of starters, pastas, main courses, and pizzas. Their wine selection is modest but well chosen, and mostly Spanish. I enjoyed my melanzane parmigiana, served fresh from the oven; and my husband’s rigatoni with gambone and chile was no less satisfying. We chose Tempranillo to compliment our meals.  The service was wonderful, the decor very low key and attractive, the location perfect for those staying near Atocha. Great option.

review_preview: Hello eveveryone! We have eaten at this nice restaurant two times, both diners. First time we had no reservation made, but they were very nice and provided a table for two given that we will take no more than 1h40min to eat.The atmosphere is...
review_full: Hello eveveryone!  We have eaten at this nice restaurant two times, both diners. First time we had no reservation made, but they were very nice and provided a table for two given that we will take no more than 1h40min to eat. The atmosphere is pleasant, the service is prompt and people are helpful and provide details on the dishes. A very good wine list to acompany the ....BEST STEAKS IN MY LIFE. I am a beef lover, I eat beef 2, 3 times a week, I cook my own steaks and I tried quite a few meat types, american, french, belgian, scotish, uruguayan, argentinian, japaneese, romanian etc. I had some really good steaks at home, and very good ones going out. But so far the experience here in Madrid was the best. After the first time we ate, i said we have to try it again. The tenderloin was melting in your mouth, the rib eye was pleasantly greasy and with the nice bbq flavor of fried fat. If you want the juicy beef, go for the 500g ribeye steak. If you want lean meat, the tenderloin is excelent. The pepper souce is also very good. I am by no means an expert in steaks, but as an amator eater I definitely recommend you to go and try this amazing steak house.

review_full: We turned up at this place on a Friday night at 8 without a booking and were told the first available table was 10-10:30pm so we booked for the next night. We had the chorizo sausage and a sort of pasty for our starters which were nice and tasty. We had ordered the mixed grill which is a sharer for two for mains but while we were eating our starters we became aware of our waitress (who was otherwise lovely throughout as were the other staff) disconcertingly hovering, waiting for us to finish. I noticed that the mixed grill was waiting under their heat lamps so I don't know what was going on there! Everything was fine service-wise after that. On reflection we thought we should have ordered a steak because we've had better mixed grills. Some of the meat was a bit fatty for us and although we usually order our steaks rare we thought medium would be the safer call - but it was all pretty much bloody. The puds were nice and the atmosphere in the restaurant was lively as it was busy and it's well appointed. So not 5 stars but a solid 4 and, as I say, we would go for a steak next time because the ones our neighbours had looked scrummy.

Menus are well setup in English and it has a non-tourist feeling inside. One small thing, though, when the table got to full with glasses and plates, our waiter moved the empty table next to us closer. If the place was packed, it would have been a tricky meal, but that gesture was nice. Was disappointed that that they did not have wifi in the restaurant. We would probably have stayed longer and ate more if we could share the meal with our friends back home.
